localization

Class UltrasonicLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class UltrasonicLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object

      Constructor for the class UltrasonicLocalizer, that uses the robot's motors to rotate on itself, and the odometer to know its position related to the grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UltrasonicLocalizer

        public UltrasonicLocalizer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                           EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                           Odometer odometer,
                           SampleProvider us,
                           float[] usData)
        Constructor for the class UltrasonicLocalizer, that uses the robot's motors to rotate on itself, and the odometer to know its position related to the grid. It localizes its surroundings by collecting data in an array.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor, - Motor for the left wheel
        rightMotor, - Motor for the right wheel
        odometer, - uses odometry to display the position of the robot
        us, - sample provider
        usData, - array that collects the data

    • Method Detail

      • doLocalization

        public void doLocalization()
        Main method that runs the program once the LocalizationLab starts the program. This is activated by a button press in the LocalizationLab, and will run doLocalization. doLocalization calls two different methods depending on the press in LocalizationLab, fallingEdge() and risingEdge() it will execute one of the following

      • collectData

        public int collectData()

      • risingEdge

        public void risingEdge()
        Method that detects the rising edge, from where the value for the distance is small, and then becomes very large since there are no wall detected anymore. this is the rising point. It uses the rising edge to localize itself in space and time and redirect itself, to the 0 degree angle, facing the positive y-axis

      • fallingEdge

        public void fallingEdge()
        Method that uses the falling edge, where the distance seen by the robot is very large, as it is facing no wall, and falling as it turns and finds a wall. This is the falling point It uses the falling points to localize itself in space and time, to be at the 0 degree angle, which is facing the positive y-axis

      • normalizeTheta

        public double normalizeTheta(double theta)
        Method that constraint the values of the thetas to be in degree between the values of [0, 360)
        Parameters:
        theta - which is the angle in degree
        Returns:
        theta, which is the angle in degree between [0,360)
